brief.brief: The Join command panel does a relational database join on two tables.
For example, you could use it to combine two tables into a single table based on a related set of fields.

detail.detail: First Source File: (file variable) Specify the first file variable from which you are extracting information.
Second Source File: (file variable) Specify the second file variable from which you are extracting information.

Join Expression: (Boolean) Specify the expression that indicates which pairs of records to extract from both tables. Service Manager checks all pairs of records from the two tables against this expression.
Target File: (file variable) Specify the file variable in which to deposit the information extracted from the source tables.
Exit if No Records in Join: (label) Specify the exit to take if there are no records in the join.
When Service Manager performs a join, it fills a third file variable with the fields in the two tables it joined.
Service Manager checks all the pairs of records extracted from the first and second file variables against the join expression.
